revision.comment: Created page with "Possibly: The banks of Esk; or, a saunter from Roslin to Smeaton, a poem, descriptive, historical, & moral; with an introductory canto, by way of retaliation upon some Engli..."
revision.text: Possibly: The banks of Esk; or, a saunter from Roslin to Smeaton, a poem, descriptive, historical, & moral; with an introductory canto, by way of retaliation upon some English authors, who have wantonly abused the people and country of Scotland. To which is added, Drummond Castle; a poem of the same kind. With an address to impudence / by James Alves. (Edinburgh : Printed by J. Pillans & Sons, 1800). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b1302738~S1
